article_title: Ray Flynn and Jim Nicholson: A Mystifying U.S. Diplomatic Pullback From the Vatican
article_text: The United States established full diplomatic relations with the Holy See in 1984, after President Ronald Reagan, with bipartisan support, persuaded Congress to join more than 150 other countries in maintaining a diplomatic mission to the Vatican. That decision proved strategically crucial, as President Reagan and Pope John Paul II worked along parallel tracks to accelerate the revolutions of 1989 and the eventual collapse of the Soviet Union. The U.S. and the Holy See have since built a strong relationship that has had a...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Ray Flynn and Jim Nicholson write that much will be lost by shutting the Embassy to the Holy See and moving its operations to America's outpost in Rome.
twitter.title: A Mystifying U.S. Diplomatic Pullback From the Vatican
